p: In late March 2014, we captured 12 amplexing common toad pairs and raised their offspring in full-sib groups of initially 60 individuals in 140 L outdoor plastic mesocosms until metamorphosis. Tadpoles developed in the presence or absence of a caged predator, represented by backswimmer imagos ( Notonecta sp.), larvae of the southern hawker ( Aeshna cyanea), juvenile sticklebacks ( Gasterosteus aculeatus) and adult, male smooth newts ( Lissotriton vulgaris).
